service-status.desc:
e.g.:

    $ tsuru service-status my_mongodb


Check status of a given service instance.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-info.desc:
show information about your app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

target-list.desc:
Displays the list of targets, marking the current.

Other commands related to target:

  - target-add: adds a new target to the list of targets
  - target-set: defines one of the targets in the list as the current target
  - target-remove: removes one target from the list

app-revoke.desc:
revokes access to an app from a team.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

plan-list.desc: List available plans that can be used when creating an app.

app-create.desc:
create a new app.

Minimum # of arguments: 2

team-user-remove.desc:
removes a user from a team.

Minimum # of arguments: 2

service-unbind.desc:
unbind a service instance from an app

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

service-info.desc:
e.g.:

    $ tsuru service-info mongodb


List all instances of a service

Minimum # of arguments: 1

token-show.desc: Show API token user. If him does not have a key, it is generated.

unit-add.desc:
add new units to an app.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

platform-list.desc: Display the list of available platforms.

unit-remove.desc:
remove units from an app.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-deploy-list.desc: List information about deploys for an application.

env-set.desc:
set environment variables for an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

plugin-install.desc:
Install tsuru plugins.

Minimum # of arguments: 2

user-create.desc:
creates a user.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-deploy-rollback.desc:
Deploys an existing image for an app. You can list available images with `tsuru app-deploy-list`.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

team-list.desc: List all teams that you are member.

target-set.desc:
Change current target (tsuru server)


Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-start.desc:
starts an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

env-unset.desc:
unset environment variables for an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

team-user-add.desc:
adds a user to a team.

Minimum # of arguments: 2

service-bind.desc:
bind a service instance to an app

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

key-add.desc:
adds a public key to your account

Minimum # of arguments: 2

service-doc.desc:
Show documentation of a service

Minimum # of arguments: 1

team-user-list.desc:
List members of a team.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

target-add.desc:
Adds a new entry to the list of available targets

Minimum # of arguments: 2

target-remove.desc:
Remove a target from target-list (tsuru server)


Minimum # of arguments: 1

token-regenerate.desc: Generates a new API key. If there is already a key, it is replaced.

reset-password.desc:
Resets the user password.

This process is composed of two steps:

1. Generate a new token
2. Reset the password using the token

In order to generate the token, users should run this command without the --token flag.
The token will be mailed to the user.

With the token in hand, the user can finally reset the password using the --token flag.
The new password will also be mailed to the user.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

plugin-remove.desc:
Remove tsuru plugins.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

env-get.desc:
retrieve environment variables for an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

app-stop.desc:
stops an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

app-remove.desc:
removes an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

service-add.desc:
e.g.:

    $ tsuru service-add mongodb tsuru_mongodb small -t myteam

Will add a new instance of the "mongodb" service, named "tsuru_mongodb" with the plan "small".

Create a service instance to one or more apps make use of.

Minimum # of arguments: 2
Maximum # of arguments: 3

user-remove.desc: removes your user from tsuru server.

service-remove.desc:
Removes a service instance

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-run.desc:
run a command in all instances of the app, and prints the output.

If you use the '--once' flag tsuru will run the command only in one unit.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.


Minimum # of arguments: 1

autoscale-config.usage: tsuru autoscale-config [-a/--app appname] --max-units unitsnumber --min-units unitsnumber --increase-step unitsnumber --increase-wait-time seconds --increase-expression expression --decrease-wait-time seconds --decrease-expression expression --enabled

key-remove.desc:
removes the given public key from your account

Minimum # of arguments: 1

cname-remove.desc:
cname-remove undoes the change that cname-add does.
After unsetting the CNAME from the app, "app-list" and "app-info" will display the internal, unfriendly address that tsuru uses.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

cname-add.desc:
cname-add will add a CNAME to the app.
It will not manage any DNS register, it's up to the user to create the DNS register. Once the app contains a custom CNAME, it will be displayed by "app-list" and "app-info".

Minimum # of arguments: 1

key-list.desc: lists public keys registered in your account

app-log.usage: tsuru app-log [-a/--app appname] [-l/--lines numberOfLines] [-s/--source source] [-u/--unit unit] [-f/--follow]
app-log.desc:
show logs for an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it. The default number of lines is 10.

app-deploy.desc:
Deploys set of files and/or directories to tsuru server. Some examples of calls are:

tsuru app-deploy .
tsuru app-deploy myfile.jar Procfile


Minimum # of arguments: 1

team-create.desc:
creates a new team.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-shell.desc: Open a remote shell to the given container, or to one of the containers of the given app.

app-set-team-owner.desc:
set app's owner team

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-grant.desc:
grants access to an app to a team.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

team-remove.desc:
removes a team from tsuru server.

Minimum # of arguments: 1

app-restart.desc:
restarts an app.

If you don't provide the app name, tsuru will try to guess it.

service-list.desc: Get all available services, and user's instances for this services

app-swap.desc:
Swap routes between two apps. Use force if you want to swap apps with different numbers of units or diferent platform without confirmation

Minimum # of arguments: 2
